Description.Name: Draugr
Description.Details: Rasalhague mercenaries fighting on behalf of the Taurian Concordat first encountered this mech in 3063 on Hellespont. The Bleak March campaign (as it later became known) saw ultimate victory for the Concordat, but not before substantial losses for local and third party forces. So-named 'Draugr' for the undead Norse revenant of myth, this Warhammer’s pilot was never identified due to the Sanctuary Worlds’ use of drone units. Draugr quickly gained notoriety not only for its savage prowess in skirmish warfare, but also for its continued and troubling reappearance after suffering complete chassis destruction on at least four separate recorded engagements across the span of six months. Mechwarriors learned to fear the high-pitched whine of its bombards arcing out of the mists, which signaled that doubled volleys of neutrino cannon and gatling fire were not far behind – followed by the horror that not even death could claim its unknown pilot, and that Draugr’s eventual reappearance was almost guaranteed. COMMUNITY CONTENT
